text: Greyhounds is my biggest income and according to the Telegraph thats going to disappear! <https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/2025/01/20/greyhound-racing-tracks-closing-britain-end-of-sport/|https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/2025/01/20/greyhound-racing-tracks-closing-britain-end-of-sport/>

attachments.fallback: The Telegraph: The slow death of greyhound racing – and why millions of fans deserted the track
attachments.text: The sport was introduced to Britain 99 years ago but, with interest waning and calls from activists to ban it, it may not live long past 100
attachments.title: The slow death of greyhound racing – and why millions of fans deserted the track

text: Crayford shut yesterday (or day before?) and my local track Henlow shut down very recently too. Newspapers need to sell their wares though so I'd worry about it when it happens, not if (although it's much easier said than done). Make hay while the sun shines.

elements.text: Crayford shut yesterday (or day before?) and my local track Henlow shut down very recently too. Newspapers need to sell their wares though so I'd worry about it when it happens, not if (although it's much easier said than done). Make hay while the sun shines.

text: When was the last time anyone here went to the dogs? I know the industry could fund it to a degree but without paying customers I don't see how that's sustainable. They're big valuable pieces of land in urban areas, no crowd = no revenue.
